website_summaries.verdict: A trusted choice for a lanolin-based nipple treatment that is long-lasting.
pros: Many customers love that this is pure lanolin
It also tends to stay on longer than some other products, and it stands out for being very protective (holding up well against moisture and water)
cons: It has a thicker consistency than some other products, and can be a bit difficult to get out of the tube

customer_reviews.title: This was recommended by a friend
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a friend, but I didn't think it was going to be much different than Vaseline. Boy was I wrong. This stuff is AMAZING! It gives IMMEDIATE relief and lasts forever. The best part is that you don't need to use a lot at all! My nipples are so sore but as soon as I put this on it somehow goes away! The weird thing is that t doesn't just take away the surface pain it clears some of the "Aching" too. I'm so happy with this! If you find my review helpful please mark it so. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: TJ's WifeTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: My new lip balm
customer_reviews.text: My new lip moisturizer. My daughter thinks it's gross to use "nipple cream" on my lips but after my lips became resistant to Vaseline and would burn and peel I had to find a replacement coming across this salve. It works wonders and a little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! Lather on a pea-sized amount after breastfeeding, or right before you hop in the shower. (It not only soothes, but protects.) It's baby-safe made from 100% sheep lanolin (a natural oil from their wool), doesn't have any unpleasant odor, and comes in convenient sized tubes for travel. It's especially helpful in the first week or so of breastfeeding because of baby learning to nurse properly and the syrupy colostrum that takes more work for baby to suck in the first place. I carry it with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: B K

customer_reviews.title: Great nipple cream and baby lotion
customer_reviews.text: This is great stuff. It is much thicker than Mandela, and you might like warming it between your fingers before use, but thinner than the less processed stuff. It doesn't smell like unprocessed lanolin, which is nice. My baby doesn't seem to mind the taste of it, and my nurses said I do not have to wash it off prior to feding_ it is baby safe, which puts it way above other lotions and creams. I also use it as a baby lotion, especially for her hands that she likes to put in her mouth. It makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Klassy Kat

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR LIP GLOSS/ BALM
customer_reviews.text: I put them in little lipgloss tubes because I use it as lip balm in the winter and it WORKS SO MUCH BETTER THAN CHAPSTICK OR VASELINE! this stuff turns my cracked lips into soft smackers as soon as I put it on 💋 I bought a 10 pack of the lip gloss tubes on Amazon for like $2, warmed up the Lanolin a little bit so it was easier to pour and get in the small tube openings, then closed em up and carry with me everywhere! one 8oz tube was enough to fill 3 gloss tubes with some extra left over. one for my purse, my car, and my nightstand 💕🙏🏼
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Lackford

customer_reviews.title: Not comparable to what is bought in stores.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using lanisoh on my lips nightly for almost three years. I ordered a tube off of Amazon, and immediately noticed a difference. It was a thinner consistency, and I was waking up with chapped lips. I finally picked up a new tube at the store, and the consistency is thicker, it stays on my lips all night, and I wake up with soft, non-chapped lips. Whatever is being shipped out is definitely not legit lanisoh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cured my chronic dry & peeling lips
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used every chapstick imaginable. Burts bees, carmex, blistex, ChapStick, aquaphor, baby lips, nothing worked. Every single day my lips were horribly dry, peeling, and I had a habit of chewing the dead skin off, which would result in even more dead skin, cracks, and rawness. This was an everyday cycle that I’ve had for years. All it took was two days of using this stuff, and I don’t have any more dead skin on my lips, and they look smooth. When I put it on at night and wake up in the morning, I can still feel a layer on my lips. This is amazing and I’m glad I finally found a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Best lip sleeping/awake balm
customer_reviews.text: New packaging, same great product. I use exclusively for my very dry lips. It’s a great moisturizer/occlusive and I find that it works better than petroleum and any other fancy lip treatment which usually contains lots of good for nothing fragance. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Thick, but soothing.
customer_reviews.text: From the first time the hospital handed me a Lanolin packet, I was sold on the importance of having a tube nearby for nursing. With each pregnancy, I stock up... tube in the diaper bag, one in the nightstand, one floating randomly in the kitchen somewhere. This stuff is a life saver. Even though the tubes seem tiny, a little dab'll do ya. It is very thick, like vaseline, so it doesn't spread terribly easy, but that thick coating is what you need. It'll heal cracks, soothe discomfort, and baby can safely consume it without any worry or regard for it. If you're a breastfeeding momma (or even a pregnant woman experiencing early dryness/discomfort), grab yourself a tube.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: great for more than intended use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the first time 23 years ago when I was breastfeeding. Recently my boyfriend kept having peeling skin all around his fingernails and the finger pads would crack; it was very painful. Nothing worked. Not cetaphil, not eczema formulas, nothing. I suggested this product and he is feeling so much better and healing. Now I'm using it for my feet, cuticles, under my eyes for terrific moisture...I forgot how great this stuff is! My theory is that if it can heal my horribly cracked, bleeding breasts and the mastitis I got then it can take care of these things too. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Sallie Ben Attar

customer_reviews.title: Great for chapped lips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because every chapstick or like brand seems to make my lips more chapped. I watched a YouTuber that recommended this brand for lips so I thought I’d try it. I originally purchased three sample sizes and really liked them so I purchased this one for my nightstand drawer. I put it on every night and wake up without chapped lips. I keep the mini sizes in various other places like my purse, my dressing table and my motorcycle bag. Works great for lips!
customer_reviews.author: TexasGigi

customer_reviews.title: Lips too!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this year around for my lips. It works well, lasts long even if it gets wet, and doesn’t feel greasy or chunky. I’ve also used it on chapped hands, cut cuticles, or dry spots on feet and it works wonders. I’ve put it on my lips before I go to bed with my full face CPAP mask and it keeps my lips from drying out in the constant blowing air. I use it during the day too. Several friends now asked put some on Whenever I am around because they have found it to be a great lip product as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Not just for nipples
customer_reviews.text: I used this cream for my lips at the recommendation of other accutane patients. It worked very well for my lips although certain chapsticks have worked equally well. I did find that it had many uses, such as for moisturizing nails and any dry patches on my body. It helped when I got eczema on the backs of my hands as well. I would recommend a patch test for this cream since many people are allergic to lanolin. If it works for you though, it is very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: this ointment rescued me
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time mom so did not know what to expect with breastfeeding. It hurts bad!! My midwife told me to get this and it removes the pain very quickly. I massaged my nipples with this before and after breast feeding. It is safe for baby and does not have a taste. Moister keeps locked it and helps with skin not cracking. this ointment literally saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby soft....LIPS!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a lip mask... Not nipple protection for nursing. I exfoliate my lips then apply this for 10-20 minutes (sometimes I just leave it on all day lol). My lips are so soft, supple and healthy looking-saw this trick on YouTube and figured it was a cheap try. SO GLAD I DID! There's no taste and w/a thin layer it's like wearing chapstick. I use a thicker layer as a lip mask a few times a week when I'm wearing any other treatment mask... That's a win-win to me!
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, just super thick and hard to wash off hands after applying.
customer_reviews.text: Lanolin has done a great job of keeping my nipples from drying out or cracking (no issues in almost 4 months so far = SUCCESS!), it does work as described. The downside for me, however, is that it's SO thick - it's a pain to get on, and then it's even more annoying to wash off of you hands after applying. Soap did almost nothing, and then I'd try to dry my hands on a towel and my fingers stick to the towel. Yuck. So, it does work - but not my favorite product. Try Organic Coconut Oil instead, does the same job but doesn't leave a mess on your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Nipple saver
customer_reviews.text: It is life saver for a nursing mom. The lactation consultant in the hospital recommends this to us. It is not scented and is edible - you don't need to wash / remove it from the nipple before feeding. Apparently it doesn't harm the baby, probably passes out of their system without being absorbed. It is easy enough to spread, you want to leave a pea sized cream on your fingertip for 30 sec so it softens a bit on the finger and turns semi transparent.
customer_reviews.author: Jie Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Forget the expensive lip balms  - this is the BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: Although I had to return the first tube because the cap wouldn't close Amazon quickly replaced the defective item and I'm so happy they did. I'm a lipstick fanatic and this stuff is amazing. I use it at bedtime and over/under lipstick and my lips are never chapped. Give it a try. I read about it on Travel and Leisure as travelers/airline personnel secret weapons. They weren't kidding - AWESOME!.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie T-D

customer_reviews.title: OK product, would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I only used the product 3 times, then I had to throw the bottle as I did not see the use for it. When my nipples were sore, they were not really helpful. My advice: try and and find some medications with plants or try a very small pakaging to see whether this will help Would not recommend the product. Had I not opened it, I would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: Claude Owona

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT for breastfeeding & makes a great lip ointment too...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for almost 2 decades! It helps the breast/nipple heal & also makes a great lip ointment for those times when you need something that won't absorb right into your skin. When I use disposable pads I put a dab of this in the center to help my nipple not stick to the pad...I also have used it for all of these years for cracked, bleeding nipples from breastfeeding tongue & lip tied babies... didn't know they were tied! This is SAFE to be ingested by your baby as it is made from lanolin from sheep's wool. I WOULD purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: WiseCrew

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Before I used this one, I have used one i bought from pharmacy / small ones /. Those were much thicker and had no smell. But this one isn't much tick, and has very slight smell in it. I don't know what smell it is, it just i can smell if I get it close to my nose. Also the cream runs if I hold on my finger tips more than 10 sec. I guess it does its job, I have been appling after every pump, but the smell and the texture bothers me a bit, probably because I compare with the same cream I used before.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lourie

customer_reviews.title: Great All Natural Nipple Cream
customer_reviews.text: This is truly all natural. If you didn't know, lanolin is a wax that is collected from sheep's wool secreted by the sebaceous glands of wool-bearing animals. So who knows, this may not just be from sheep? Whatever. It works wonders. Saved my nipples during the first several weeks of breastfeeding. Also works as a great mositurizer in combination with coconut all. All the greasy feeling skin. Seriously, love it because after my second kid my skin has been dry and ashy all the freaking time.
customer_reviews.author: haha_yeahTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason everyone recommends it...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver! Nursing did not come automatically or naturally to me. It took us a few days for me and baby to figure it out together. That learning curve, included a frustrated baby and a new found best friend in my breast pump... These two things together lead to soreness and chafing. But this product saved us. Even now that we've gotten the hang of things, it makes nursing and pumping so much easier and (almost painless).
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I use this on my lips
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. It was recommended by Dominque Sachse. I put this on at night and sometimes during the day. My lips are so soft now. I even have used this on my hand where I have dry, rough spot on my index finger that I have had for years. Now it feels so soft. Go figure that this was made for your nipples.....LOL. Now a lot of us gals are using it for our lips. If it is good for the nips, then it is good for the lips.......Love it.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I got this creme when I started breastfeeding my daughter. I was in excruciating pain and my nipples were cracked, bleeding, and I couldn’t put my clothes on because it hurt so much. Once I got the creme, I felt much better within a day or two of using it and back to normal within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Polonsky

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not as effective as breastmilk
customer_reviews.text: It relieves some of my nipple pain. It is nice and give moisture on the site. But, my baby hates it. He won’t take my breast if I put it on. I have to clean my nipple before breastfeeding. Besides, it is not as effective as my breastmilk. So, I stopped putting this product on my nipple and put breastmilk on instead.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Totally a miracle cream! Don't know what I will do without it. Makes a huge difference I use is after each feed and before and after baths
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Works to soothe overworked nipples
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be a good salve for my nipples when the baby's been feeding particularly frequently. I use it in conjunction with the Lansinoh Gel pads which I put in the fridge. But what I like about this cream is that you can breastfeed after using this, which just makes it convenient for those nightly feeds whereas you need to wipe your breast after using the gel pads.
customer_reviews.author: SFtraveler

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Most Momma’s Breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, I loved this product and used it with multiple of our 6 kids for breastfeeding. I was told many times that nursing shouldn’t hurt but let me say if you go from nothing rubbing over and over to a baby nursing every hour, you are going to have some soreness so don’t listen to them. After about 2-3 weeks things will toughen up but in the meantime this is an outstanding product to help get through those weeks to enjoy such a beautiful moment of feeding, nourishing, and cuddling your sweetness.
customer_reviews.author: 1CrazyLife4Me

customer_reviews.title: Sticky and greasy!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this cream. It feels like you are covering yourself with honey. It sticks to clothes, stains and leaves you walking around feeling horrible. Doesn't help nipple pain at all. When you wipe it or clean your nipples from it, it just smears and even your hands feel sticky. Takes a few washes to get it out completely. And it hurts even more after all this.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Lanolin Cream
customer_reviews.text: This is nipple cream for nursing mothers. I used it on my dogs chapped nose. He has allergies and licks his nose a lot so it is all chapped. Since it was safe for a baby, I figured it would be safe for a dog. Helps to moisten his noise so it doesn't crack. Goes on easily and coats well.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle worker. I've had itchy nipples for many years. I don't know what was causing. I have used many products and some worked temporarily but the itch would always come back. I came upon this product by chance and gave it a shot, not expecting much. I knew after one use that this was something special. After only three days, the itch went away. I stopped using it after a week. It's been 3 months and my nipples are well and the itch has not come back. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Choxie

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: I would say “tmi” but you’re reading a review about nipple cream.. they’re all “tmi”. This is the only thing that relieves my itchy nipples (currently pregnant). I feel like I have to re-apply quite frequently on the really bad days, but that doesn’t bother me. The bottle is pretty small (a little goes a long way, you don’t need a large bottle) so it easily fits in my purse to carry with me. The smell is minimal, a little bit minty, but nothing crazy which is good since I’m hyper-sensitive to smells.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Best lip balm ever
customer_reviews.text: I saw this used in a video on youtube for a lip balm and decided to try it. This is the perfect lip balm, a tiny dab is plenty, glides on smoothly and truly moisturizes and heals. It has a pleasant taste, very subtle, such that babies would approve of. In fact I wish I'd has this when I was nursing my children. As a lip balm it has chapstick beat by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Binnie

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but I wouldn’t recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings about this product: does it work? For the most part, yes. It’s thick and creamy and will help with nipple discomfort and dryness. Would I recommend? No, I’d advise looking into an alternative. I think there are better products that will spread easier and are more nourishing. Also, this product is oil so it will damage your clothes. I have ruined several blouses because of the lanolin oil. I suggest looking at a nipple butter instead.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: A must for your breastfeeding journey!
customer_reviews.text: Breastfeeding isn't for the faint of heart. The first couple weeks are ROUGH on your nipples. Thank goodness a friend recommended I get this cream prior to me giving birth so I was already prepared. Make sure you apply this after every breastfeeding session so your nipples can remain happy and moist, never cracked which can lead to bacteria festering and potential infections.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Helped my dried nipples during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Helped my dried nipples during pregnancy. None of the lotions worked for me (Not even Cetaphil). It is the only product that the doctor recommended because it is safe both for the mother and the baby. I'm planning to use it continuously after the delivery.
customer_reviews.author: M'sh

customer_reviews.title: Helps with dry nipples.
customer_reviews.text: Personally for me, I didn't find this lanolin cream essential for my breastfeeding journey, but this did help during the cluster feedings. I stopped using this as nipple cream about six months in breastfeeding, and started using it as chapstick. I didn't use this everyday, only when my nipple were dry and chapped, so one bottle was enough for me. Baby had no reaction when the lanolin was on my nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Don't use stuff that is unsealed
customer_reviews.text: This is the third product I've received opened and unsealed. I've only used Amazon for 3 months but if this is what you get, I'll pass
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer gillilan

customer_reviews.title: Quick Acting. Safe. Healing. Multiple Uses!
customer_reviews.text: This is like a miracle healer. When my sons' cheeks get red and chapped, I rub this on and the red disappears within hours. When my knuckles get so dry and cracked from washing all the time, this heals it up quick! This is great for diaper rashes, too! This is the best and safest thing out there to use for minor rashes and cuts! Oh, I also use when I get itchy skin from allergies (takes the itch away better than itch creams filled with tons of ingredients). Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: 4thesunsets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for relief, but WARNING - stains clothes.
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute essential for any nursing mom. One tube lasts me about two weeks. I put it on after almost every time I nurse. WARNING::: This stains clothes. Several of my shirts now have oil like stains that do not come out after trying to wash them multiple times. I’ve used oxi clean and other scrubs and nothing has worked. If you use these, make sure you cover with nursing pads or a bra so your shirts don’t get ruined :(
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breastfeeding!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I bought this first, then bought another brand in a bigger size, but I liked this one better so I ordered more of this instead. The squeeze tube is very convenient. It also spreads much better than the other brand, and is clear instead of a dark yellow color which I like better. I use this for soreness from breastfeeding, and I apply it every other time or so, and it is helping a lot! Keeps me moisturized and is safe for the baby too. Great product and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Vermeulen

customer_reviews.title: Not like the one from store
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same cream that i ordered the other time. Different packing, smell, and consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppinghollik

customer_reviews.title: Deep moisturizing. Good for super sore nips and overnight.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried this cream and Medela’s nipple cream. Both are good, this one provides more moisturization. It’s thicker and what I use if I have a particularly painful feed session or when I go to bed for deep relief. Medela nipple cream is good for during pumping/after every breast feed/moderate relief, Lansinoh is better for after a difficult or painful latch, sore nipples, small nipple bleeds and overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Page

customer_reviews.title: Hard working nips deserve better
customer_reviews.text: This might work, but it is damn hard to get it out of the tube and when you get it on it is so globular that it is difficult to spread on what can be reasonably presumed to be sore nips. Poor little things are going through a lot. Go for Boobease or something like the lansinoh gel pads. Your poor nippies will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has been a breastfeeding game changer for me. Super moisturizing, making breastfeeding so much more comfortable. I try to put it on after every feeding. Easy to spread. Only downside is that it’s gotten on a few of my bras and it looks like a grease stain that doesn’t seem to come out in the wash. Just be careful around your shirt and you’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney D

customer_reviews.title: Great for all breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use while breastfeeding for my sore/crack nipples and it works very well! I always put a pad on it so that it does not stain my clothes. It's also great that I do not need to wipe this off before breastfeeding my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Yushi W.

customer_reviews.title: All Natural Lanolin!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this product to help my dry lips. After exfoliating, I apply the lanolin and it really helps keep them soft. The air is so dry in AZ so I use it after applying lipstick as well to keep them from splitting. Also using it on my heels after putting on cream to moisturize --the lanolin keeps the moisture in and keeps the heels soft. It also helps stop the painful splitting on my heels from wearing flip flops! Very thick, transparent cream. I highly recommend. Nice information sheet with product.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L.

customer_reviews.title: Too thick
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine but it is very thick and leaves a thick residue on your hands. Hard to rub it in. I prefer the medela lanolin or even some of the smaller natural brands to this. I wouldn’t throw out the tubes that I already have but I won’t be buying any more. Using this as a backup in case I run out of my other lanolin brands.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: A must have for breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: Great for breastfeeding moms. It gives you so much relief during those first few weeks of breastfeeding. Also, when babies teeth they can sometimes make you raw from biting while feeding and it does a great job healing you from that as well. I highly recommend this a moms must have.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Lansinoh Lanolin
customer_reviews.text: Every nursing mom should get this. It lasts forever and works so well to help prevent chapped bleeding nipples. WIth my oldest I didn't start using it till after I started nursing and my nipples were bleeding and sore. It worked to help heal it and keep them from getting worse. With my second I started using it about a week before she was born and I never got sore bleeding nipples. Im expecting my third in a few weeks and I'm already using it. Once my nipples toughen up and I don't have to use it anymore, I use the leftover tube for my lips and heels. Works great for all dry, chapped skin.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Only been breastfeeding a few days and already love it
customer_reviews.text: My baby is only a few days old and I've already been using this product every time after I nurse. It really helps, whether you have chapped/bleeding nipples or not. I've been able to avoid any cracks or scabs but even so, learning to breastfeed makes your nipples sore and sensitive and as soon as you put the lanolin on you get some relief. I love that it's safe for the baby so doesn't have to be washed off before feeding her. Also, it's 100% lanolin which is much more soothing than lanolin mixed with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Great moisturizer for dry skin problems!  I use it around my eyes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have dermatitis around my eyes, which causes flaking, itching and my eyelids sometimes crack. I have been using this moisturizer regularly around my eyes, and it has cleared all this up. Very soothing. It keeps the skin around my eyes from drying out.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Provides healing
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. This cream is safe for baby which makes it great for breastfeeding. It really helped my nipples heal after they were cracked from an incorrect latch and again after becoming raw from a poorly designed pump. I use this regularly to protect my nipples and love the way it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Great for dry hands too!
customer_reviews.text: While I am a nursing mama, I actually bought this for my extremely dry hands general winter dryness, plus cleaning, plus extra hand washing due to lots of colds and flus around our house this season). I wanted something all natural and effective. I am not very good about putting this on regularly, but even with putting it on every few days at night before I go to bed I notice a good bit of difference the next day. It is greasy, but it absorbs fairly quickly. This stuff definitely does the trick for anywhere you have dry and cracking skin. Two (well moisturized) thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: mommyof3

customer_reviews.title: My Nipples Owe This Product a "Thank You"
customer_reviews.text: Two days after giving birth and breastfeeding, one of my nipples was already starting to crack and the pain was intense. This seriously saved my nipple! It's easy to apply, there is no fragrance at all, and it helps my nipples from sticking to my nipple pads after feedings. My only wish is that they offered this in a bigger tube so I didn't have to buy so many. Other than that, this is a perfect product and I would recommend it to any breastfeeding momma out there!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: It was okay...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I haven't tried other brands so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I can rate just from personal experience. It was very thick, which at first seemed like a good thing but it was not easy to spread at all. And for my nips to be sore from pumping and breastfeeding all day and night, I want something soft and soothing. It was uncomfortable trying to smooth it out on my nip and did not feel good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Wife doesn’t like this cream.
customer_reviews.text: My wife tried this cream for a month and did not like it so we ended buying earth mama nipple butter. She did not like this cream because it was hard to spread and it was really sticky. The other one she uses is really smooth and doesn’t leave that sticky feeling. It did however help with the soreness but overall she likes the other cream better.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Patel

customer_reviews.title: Basically a miracle cream
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuff for everything. I mainly bought it to use as a lip balm after using a similar product in the past. A tiny bit goes a long way, and is the best lip moisturizer I've used. I also use it on my nose to relieve irritated skin when I'm blowing my nose from a cold. It has a very slight waxy-like scent when first applied, but the scent disappears quickly so it's great to use around the nose. It's great for any small dry patches of skin, for taming unruly eyebrows, and for protecting small cuts. Basically it can solve any problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our lactation consultant told us not to use it
customer_reviews.text: Seemed ok. But the lactation consultants we saw all told us not to use it. They recommended coconut oil for moisture and prevention, or hydrogel pads for healing. Also it gums up breast pumps so you’d have to wash it off before pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Da

customer_reviews.title: Feel and looks like plain vaseline
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Lansinoh years ago and it used to be a thick, thick cream almost water proof. Now it feels like Vaseline, it is softer, much softer just like Vaseline and it is not stick anymore, and it does not last on the skin as it used to. I read on the ingredients and it says "modified lanolin", what the heck that means? I want real lanolin, and this doesn't feel like it....There is no smell at all and even the color is like vaseline. For me it is just ok. I am quite disappointed because it is pricey. I was expecting the same quality I once new and loved, but it is definitely not the same anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ana G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This really helped me out when first learning to breastfeed. Safe for me and baby so really helped when my body needed time getting used to this new thing. I used this before and after nursing, in showers and baths, as well as on baby’s face when she had a little irritation from adhesive used at hospital (pediatrician told me to and it worked).
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Works well but leaves residue on clothes.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have a problem yet with dry or cracked nipples but I did try this out. It coats the nipple well and protects it so if I did have an issue I'd definitely use. One problem though is a couple weeks back I used it and put on my bra without any breast pads. Well the stuff got on my bra and I've washed it a couple times at least and it's still on my bra! ! It doesn't wash out for some reason and its driving me nuts. It feels all sticky. Not enjoying that so definately wear breast pads when you use!!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Grove

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for nursing mamas
customer_reviews.text: One of my nurses gave me a sample size of lanolin cream for my sore, cracking nipples after I gave birth. I'm a first time mom and didn't know how rough breastfeeding could be. I bought more as soon as we got home from the hospital. This stuff works miracles. My nipples look and feel completely normal now. What a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: as a few friends had recommended. Post birth I used after every feeding
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't have been able to breastfeed this long if it wasn't for this product!! I bought three tubes.. one stays next to my chair, another in the diaper bag and the last one In my pump bag. I started using the cream about 2 weeks before having my baby daily, as a few friends had recommended. Post birth I used after every feeding, didn't skip a single time for the first 2 or 3 months. So far haven't had any cracking or bleeding. The cream really helps soothe your nipples and prevents any cracking. Now as baby is 4 months, I admit I don't use after every feeding, but still use once a day
customer_reviews.author: Zq

customer_reviews.title: Works great but stickiness is a bit off-putting.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my lips because my acne medication tends to really dry me out. Product works well and is definitely hydrating. Only reason it’s 4 and not 5 stars is because it’s very sticky and has a somewhat grainy texture when applied to the lips which is unpleasant. No noticeable fragrance or taste. Is nice around the nostrils when I have a cold as well!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for breastfeeding mothers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I started breastfeeding my son and it was heaven-sent for the pain that came along with it. It helped heal my cracked, blistered nipples AND helped tremendously with the soreness. It is very thick so it is a little difficult to spread on but it is totally worth it. If you are a new mom and plan to breastfeed this is a must-have!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Reed

customer_reviews.title: nips tonlips
customer_reviews.text: Cattlebaronincashmere said this was really great as we loose moisture at 40 and this really helps. I love it. My lips are so soft now.
customer_reviews.author: Gibby's

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It arrived earlier than expected, and I was satisfied with my purchase and the amount that I paid for it. And I was waiting by the mailbox because I needed it for my nipples. I normally use the Madela brand. But I chose this one to see how the product works. And I can say that I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Broken top! Unable to use.  No return policy :(
customer_reviews.text: Product came to me broken from the top head part. Won’t seal back unless I put entire cream into something else :( and no return policy ugh!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for dry lips in the winter!
customer_reviews.text: I had dry and peeling lips and was searching for something to help and was willing to try just about anything! I read somewhere that this product works well for dry cracking winter lips. I LOVE this stuff for lips. It leaves lips hydrated, stops peeling, has no smell or taste and the moisture lasts on the lips. The tube is an awesome size is perfect to last through the winter and beyond!
customer_reviews.author: Lea DoubleYou

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and thick which is exactly what you need when you have chaffed cracked nipples. It didn't help me with the pain instantly, I don't think anything will but after using for a whole day after feeling like giving up from the pain, it was a complete reset and my nipples started to heal.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva A.

customer_reviews.title: Trusted and true. Works like it says
customer_reviews.text: I used this during my last pregnancy and it did the job. I've also used it as chap stick and diaper rash ointment when I ran out one time. Heads up it is thick and gooey and pricey for the amount you get. But it provides relief to sore dry or cracked nipples.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It fell behind my bed so I grabbed a free sample of Ameda triple zero lanolin and surprisingly liked it better. My nipples were cracked and bleeding at the time. Lasinoh lanolin is still a great product, but when it runs out I may consider switching
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps heal sore nipples!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver for new moms who are new to breastfeeding. I used it when just starting off and it was definitely soothing on my sore nipples. Now that my little guy and I have our technique down I use it to lubricate the flanges on my pump to make that less painful as well. Since then, pumping has been so much easier! The only downside is that when I was using it directly on my nipples a lot when they were chapped I would notice a buildup on my little’s lips after a feeding. I don’t think he liked that very much but I could have also been using too much.
customer_reviews.author: trizi

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for dry lips too!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use as intended - I use it in my dry, cracked lips and it’s the only thing that keeps them hydrated. It’s thick but you don’t have to use a lot. It’s also great for dry knuckles and elbows. It was recommended to me years ago by an esthetician and she was right!
customer_reviews.author: Nom de Plume

customer_reviews.title: Many uses! LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this lanolin for years for soft lips. Bought to use on my puppy's paw pads that were like sand paper. Used once and like magic! Pads already softer and she did not lick it up and few minutes after rubbed in they were dry. This product has many great uses that are all safe! <3
customer_reviews.author: Shirley J. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Does wonders for your nips and lips!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a FTM and exclusively pumping for my little guy. This nipple cream has been doing wonders for my nipples. I haven’t had any cracks other than some soreness, but that comes with constantly pumping 2-3 hours a day. I also spread the remaining on my lips as a moisturizer and it has been so soft! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MCY07

customer_reviews.title: soothing
customer_reviews.text: I tried this first with my cracked nipple since that's what the hospital sent me home with. I used it religiously for the first 3 months and my cracked nipple didn't heal and actually got worse. it is very think and can be hard to put on. I ended up buying the medela brand of lanolin and it healed me fast and has kept me feeling good while breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for lips!
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this for chapstick and WOW. It’s better than anything else I’ve ever tried. I definitely recommend this to someone with chronic dry lips. And 1 tube of this will last you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, does what it’s supposed to do, definitely soothing for cracked or peeling nipples. I give it 4 stars because I personally prefer Medela nipple cream. Also, a little goes a long way! Haven’t even used close to 1/4 of this tube & I've been EBF for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I really disliked this nipple cream. I tried it and it made it worse. When you put it on it like coats your nipple but I found it was too gel like and hard to get off. It says to put it on before a shower to protect them and when I did that it made the gel harden and it did not help my cracked nipples. I ended up using boob ease from target and I could swear by boob ease cause that cream really did work!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Face Moisturizer
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to many things in normal face moisturizers and soaps. I have used this for years on my face, hands, and anywhere dry. It is sticky when it goes on, but sinks in quickly and the stickiness disappears. It makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Nealzilla

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: It has no scent so I’m not sure about that but I use this for my daughters when they have really chapped lips or cracks around their finger nails. My mom had laser surgery on her face and it was burned pretty bad. She used this as well and it is just amazing. I keep a bottle on hand at all times.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Used for over the span of 11 years!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for over the span of 11 years (the age of my oldest). I didn’t have to deal with any cracking or discomfort with the lubrication. I love it most because it’s all natural and doesn’t harm the baby. I didn’t have to use it every day besides in the very beginning. I still have the same tube. A lot goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product works effectively to heal dry, cracked, sore nipples between feedings and it prevents nipple irritation from clothing. This product also lubricated my nipples before pumping and reduced my pain from pumping when used immediately beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany L.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wouldn't buy a second time.. I bought both this one and the mamma mio nipple balm and I honestly recommend the mamma mio.. It smooth and spreads evenly without rubbing to hard on your akrey sensitive nipples where this one is hard like wax and no matter how many times you rub it against your finger tips its still a pain to apply on the nipples.. Save yourself the pain!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Poleth

customer_reviews.title: I live for this stuff with my newborn!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Lansinoh as I nursed as I nursed all of my babies. I tried other nipple creams that I was satisfied with, but I still prefer this nipplle cream over all of the others. It’s a trusty staple. My only complaint is that It seems like the size of the tube has progressively gotten smaller bee the years.
customer_reviews.author: Tomorrah H Stallings

customer_reviews.title: A breastfeeding must have!
customer_reviews.text: I am honestly not sure what I would do without this nipple cream. I just had my first baby and it has absolutely been a lifesaver. My nipples were so painful and starting to crack, and this cream helped immediately. Thick, yet still easy to spread, and no scent!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is gold! I have used it for almost a decade. Not just for using as a nipple cream. It is the best diaper rash/anti irritant cream ever! It doesn't contain any harsh ingredients that most other diaper creams contain; it's just lanolin. Perfect for sensitive little bottoms!
customer_reviews.author: ArtistMommy

customer_reviews.title: Very thick when applied, but seems to work
customer_reviews.text: You do not need to apply a lot of this stuff, as the tiniest dab covers a great amount of surface area. It does apply on really thick and does need to be rubbed in quite a bit. Seems to be working though as long as you can get past the sticky feeling.
customer_reviews.author: JH2

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for dry lips and dry skin
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I saw it on a youtube channel and I'm glad I tried it out. Not just for breastfeeding! Don't the packaging fool you. it makes dry patches of skin supple instantly and soothes cracked lips within hours. I'll certainly be purchasing this product again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Giron

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Lansinoh!
customer_reviews.text: This saved my nipples! I was having so much pain breastfeeding until this cream came into my life. I would recommend purchasing this for your hospital bag so you can start using as soon as your little one gets here.
customer_reviews.author: Future CPA

customer_reviews.title: Kiss your cracking, chapped lips goodbye!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine told me she was using this stuff for her lips and that they saved her. I was super skeptical; I've tried every lip balm and moisturizer and gloss that you could think of without any success. My lips would always get chapped and dry and peel. It's been like this for years and has only been getting worse. But this stuff is really a miracle: I haven't had any issues with my lips since I bought it and started using it. Just apply as needed each day.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sohaney

customer_reviews.title: Use this for dry nasal passages
customer_reviews.text: My doctor suggested i use this at night to prevent my inner nasal airways from drying out and turning into a bloody nose in dry weather. I've used this for several months and it's really helped (when i use it consistently). It doesn't have a smell and keeps my nostrils from drying out for at least 8 hours when I'm asleep. Would recommend if you get bloody noses from dry weather.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gantos

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but used for chapped lips
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I am embarrassed to say, I actually bought this for severe chapped lips after reading about it in a blog lol. Surprisingly, it works great for that. I put it on at night before bed, and in the morning after brushing my teeth. My lips are lots better, so I can recommend for chapped lips :)
customer_reviews.author: Brookeh

customer_reviews.title: Cannot have enough
customer_reviews.text: Absolute must if you decide to breastfeed! I have multiple tubes. Keep in mind it will stain clothing but fortunately I have designated nursing clothes that were inexpensive so I don’t have to worry. I was always in search of must have products being a first time mom and this is definitely one of them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for chafe and sore nipple area. I'm a first time mom and I tried this when my nipples were sore and very achy. It helps a ton! Also, it's got a very thick consistency, like vaseline, but that helps keep it moisturized for a good 24 hours. I love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Holy grail!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver!! Being pregnant you have all kinds of situations happen with your breast and this is definitely my go to product and will come in handy when I start breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: I use this for dry skin...works well.
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this cream when I was breastfeeding my twins...but...my unconventional use for it is on dry spots on my face before I put on makeup. Works well. Consistency is a bit sticky...warm up in fingers to spread easier. Tube says you can use the cream for dry skin...good price for lanolin.
customer_reviews.author: FegelyTwinMommy

product_meta.title: Lansinoh Lanolin Nipple Cream for Breastfeeding, 1.41 Ounces
product_meta.description:
Lansinoh Lanolin Nipple Cream for breastfeeding provides relief for mom and is safe for baby. Lansinoh nipple cream soothes and protects sore nipples and is so pure does not need to be removed prior to breastfeeding! It is 100% natural, hypoallergenic, and free of preservatives. Millions of breastfeeding moms trust Lansinoh nipplecream to provide relief. 

Our lanolin nipplecream is the #1 recommended nipple cream by moms, lactation consultants and doctors in the US and contains of only 100% natural lanolin.

Lansinoh Lanolin nipple butter goes beyond just breastfeeding - it's a skincare staple! It is so close to our own skin's oils, it's been used as a moisturizer and skin protector for centuries. Lansinoh nipple balm works by creating a barrier on top of the skin that softens it and prevents moisture loss. Makeup artists and beauty insiders agree it's perfect for use as a lanolin lip balm and for moisturizing heels, cuticles and more. It can even be used to enhance eyebrow definition or as a base to create a custom makeup shade. It's the perfect addition to your makeup bag.

Founded by a breastfeeding mom, Lansinoh has been committed to helping moms succeed in breastfeeding for over 30 years. Famous for our award-winning cornerstone product, Lanolin Nipple Cream, Lansinoh is a leader in breastfeeding pumps, products, and accessories. Store the Lansinoh Lanolin Nipple Cream with the cap on, in a dry place at room temperature when not in use.
feature_bullets: #1 recommended brand: Lansinoh Lanolin is the #1 recommended nipple cream by moms and doctors in the US. Clinically tested. Lansinoh Lanolin soothes and protects sore nipples for breastfeeding moms.
Safe for mom & baby: No need to remove before breastfeeding. Specially designed for nursing, 100% natural and hypoallergenic. Free from preservatives, parabens, fragrance or taste.

Relief for sore nipples: Thick, rich cream soothes and protects sore nipples. Clinically proven and ultra-pure. Our single ingredient lanolin has a unique purification process to remove impurities with no added additives.

Essential for breastfeeding: Use to soothe and protect delicate skin. Wash hands thoroughly. Soften a pea-sized amount between fingers and apply to the entire nipple area after each feeding or as needed. Apply before showering to protect sensitive nipples.

Mom founded & parent led: Founded by a breastfeeding mom, Lansinoh has supported moms for 35 years with award winning breast pumps, nipple creams, nursing pads, and breast milk storage bags, helping families create bonds that last a lifetime. Also great for elbows.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061.
